If a person in the world does not only practice patience, wherever he is born, he will not encounter the Buddha's world, go against the Dharma, and be far from the Sangha. He will always be in the three evil paths, ending and beginning again, and will always have eons of suffering.

If they are reborn as humans due to remaining blessings, they will always be foolish and cruel, with a jealous mind that slanders sages and reviles the most revered, resulting in an ugly appearance, being disliked by many, being born poor, not obtaining official positions, having wishes go against their intentions, not being aided by celestial spirits and sages, always having nightmares, with strange apparitions at the beginning and end, flying calamities spreading in all directions, living in unrest, and always being fearful.
The reason for this is because of not being able to subdue the evil mind, which causes this to happen.

Those who practice patience and subdue evil will always be at ease in their rebirths, with calamities disappearing, wishes coming true as intended, with a radiant appearance, a strong body with few illnesses, wealth, glory, and nobility, all due to the virtue of patience and kindness in saving others.
The blessings of patience bring peace to the body and family, with the clan living in harmony and never unhappy.
The wise deeply see this and subdue their minds.
The mind deceives people, destroys families, and endangers one's body. One is punished by the king's law, burned in hell, becomes a hungry ghost, or an animal, all due to the mind's faults.
The World-Honored One said again:
It is better to pierce the abdomen with a sharp sword, cut the flesh, and throw oneself into the fire;
Be careful not to tread on evil.
It is better to carry Mount Sumeru on one's head, crush one's life, and throw oneself into the great ocean to be swallowed by fish and turtles;
Be careful not to do evil.
Do not speak recklessly without understanding its meaning.
The Buddha's clear Dharma is contrary to worldly customs. What the world treasures, the Way despises.
The currents of clarity and turbidity flow differently. The paths of the wise and the foolish are different. The loyal and the deceitful are enemies. The deviant always envies the correct.
Therefore, those who indulge in desires do not like my practice of being without desire.
It is better to swallow burning charcoal than to slander the Three Jewels.
The brightness of forbearance surpasses that of the sun and moon.
The strength of dragons and elephants can be said to be vigorous, but compared to forbearance, it is not even a hundredth or a thousandth.
The radiance of the seven treasures is valued by ordinary people, but it brings worries and disasters;
The treasure of forbearance brings peace from beginning to end.
Although giving to the ten directions has great blessings, the blessings are not as good as forbearance.
Embracing forbearance and practicing kindness, generation after generation there is no enmity, the mind is tranquil, and there is ultimately no harm.
In the world there is nothing to rely on, only forbearance can be relied upon.
Forbearance is a peaceful home, where calamities do not arise;
Forbearance is a divine armor, where weapons cannot harm;
Forbearance is a great ship, which can ferry one through difficulties;
Forbearance is a good medicine, which can save many lives.
For those who practice forbearance, what wishes are not attained?

If you wish to become a flying emperor, rule the four continents, be a second-rank heavenly emperor, or ascend to the sixth heaven, with an infinite lifespan, a fragrant and pure body, and all your wishes naturally fulfilled, like taking things from your own home;
